org.cougaar.util
Interface TimeSpan

All Known Subinterfaces:
Aggregation, Allocation, AllocationforCollections, AssetTransfer, AssignedAvailabilityElement, AssignedRelationshipElement, CommunityPG, Disposition, Expansion, ItineraryElement, LocationRangeScheduleElement, LocationScheduleElement, NewAssignedAvailabilityElement, NewAssignedRelationshipElement, NewCommunityPG, NewExpansion, NewItineraryElement, NewLocationRangeScheduleElement, NewLocationScheduleElement, NewPlanElement, NewRelationshipSchedule, NewRoleSchedule, NewSchedule, NewScheduleElement, NewTimePhasedPropertyGroup, NewTimeSpan, PEforCollections, PlanElement, PlanElementForAssessor, Relationship, RelationshipSchedule, RoleSchedule, Schedule, ScheduleElement, ScheduleElementWithValue, TimePhasedPropertyGroup
All Known Implementing Classes:
AggregationImpl, AllocationImpl, AssetTransferImpl, AssignedAvailabilityElementImpl, AssignedRelationshipElementImpl, AssignedRelationshipScheduleImpl, CommunityPG.Future, CommunityPG.Null_CommunityPG, CommunityPGImpl, DispositionImpl, ExpansionImpl, ItineraryElementImpl, LocationRangeScheduleElementImpl, LocationScheduleElementImpl, MutableTimeSpan, PlanElementImpl, RelationshipImpl, RelationshipScheduleImpl, RoleScheduleImpl, ScheduleElementImpl, ScheduleImpl, TaggedLocationScheduleElement, TimeSpan.Point, TimeSpan.Span
public interface TimeSpan

An abstraction of an object which starts at a known point in time and ends before a known point in time. Note that the interval is closed with respect to the start point, open with respect to the end point and start must be strictly less than end. An interval where start==end is illegal, as it would indicate a negative 1 millisecond duration. A point in time must be represented with end = start+EPSILON. A TimeSpan that does not have well-defined start and end times is also illegal. For example a set of TimeSpans might also be a TimeSpan (e.g. Schedule) (with start and end times bounding the start and end times of all the members of the set). If the set were empty, there would be no well-defined start and end times. Such a TimeSpan would be illegal. The values are usually interpreted to mean milliseconds in java time, though there is nothing which actually requires these semantics. Note that while the interface is not required to be serializable, most implementations (including the static inner classes here) will actually be so.

See Also:
for a collection of factory methods.

Constant Field Values

MIN_VALUE

static final long MIN_VALUE
A value to indicate unbounded StartTime. The actual value was chosen so that (MAX_VALUE-MIN_VALUE) is still a long.

See Also:

A value to indicate unbounded EndTime. The actual value was chosen so that (MAX_VALUE-MIN_VALUE) is still a long.
